metadata.name: System Disk And Volume Reconnaissance Via Wmic.EXE
metadata.comment: An adversary might use WMI to discover information about the system, such as the volume name, size, free space, and other disk information. This can be done using the `wmic` command-line utility and has been observed being used by threat actors such as Volt Typhoon.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\wmic.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('wmic.exe') AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('volume')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('path win32_logicaldisk'))))

output.summary: An adversary might use WMI to discover information about the system, such as the volume name, size, free space, and other disk information. This can be done using the `wmic` command-line utility and has been observed being used by threat actors such as Volt Typhoon.
